results.title: Germany a Southern menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Presents a Southern German meal prepared with flair by master Chef Helmut Abrell, to whom cooking is an art form.

results.title: Germaine Greer's Sydney
results.creator_credit: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cities”.
A look at Sydney with Germaine Greer. She comments on it being a city “where the poorest people can be millionaires. Where, for practically nothing, you can do the same things that in other countries you have to join select clubs to do.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: John McGreevy, Pat Ferns, Nielsen-Ferns International and John McGreevy Productions

results.title: Germ art

Music and sound design by Kit Webster.

results.title: Geraldton
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Geraldton, Western Australia, is a fast developing town as it is the major supply centre and port of the north of the state. A glimpse of the people, industries, such as building and crayfishing, and social life of Geraldton.

results.title: Gerald Mcboing boing (K)
results.creator_credit: United Productions of America, Bosustow Entertainment, Stephen Bosustow and Robert Cannon
results.brief_description: At first, young Gerald’s boings, honks, beeps, toots and train whistle noises nearly drive his parents crazy - and when time and even school fail to teach him to actually talk like other children, the situation grows bleaker. Rejected by his peers, an outcast in a world of words, the friendless Gerald runs away from home. Then from a dark and dreadful snowstorm he is rescued by the owner of a radio station who needs just such a lad for his sound effects department. At last Gerald has found his niche. From the story by Dr Seuss, adapted by Bill Scott and Phil Eastman and narrated by Marvin Miller. Animation by Bill Melendez, Rudy Larriva, Pat Matthews, Willis Pyle, Frank Smith. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Georgy girl
results.creator_credit: Everglades Productions, Robert A. Goldston, Otto Plaschkes and Silvio Narizzano
results.brief_description: A quintiessential “swinging 60’s” comedy, starring Lynn Redgrave in the title role of Georgy. Gauche and out of place in her flatmate Meredith’s sexually liberated world, Georgy longs for a traditional romance with a husband and children. Meredith, (Charlotte Rampling), lives for the moment and the next man. Currently that man is Jos played by Alan Bates. When Meredith becomes pregnant, it is Georgy who becomes maternal, and the object of not only Jos’s affection, but that of a lascivious wealthy widower played by James Mason. Ultimately, Georgy gets all that she desires. Lynn Redgrave touchingly conveys Georgy’s warmth and naivety, while Rampling gives an excellent performance as the moody and insensitive Meredith. This is an effervescent film, well known for the title song performed by The Seekers.

results.title: Georgie to the rescue
results.creator_credit: Viking Films Miniature Film Studios, Israel M. Berman and Richard Slapczynski
results.brief_description: An animated film about Mr and Mrs Whittaker who live in the country with their pet cat and their friends Miss Oliver the owl and Georgie the gentle ghost. Based on the book by Robert Bright.
